intro: Anisacanthus nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaragua milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat succulent. This species is adapted to grow in dry, sunny environments and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils.
